New Records: Framber Valdez threw a no-hitter against the Cleveland Guardians on Aug. 1, 2023.
Framber Valdez nearly had a second no-hitter earlier this month before Corey Seager homered with two outs in the ninth inning of a 4-2 win over Texas on Aug. 6.
Key Match Events: Framber Valdez has not allowed a hit through seven innings Friday night against the Kansas City Royals.
He struck out the side in the third and struck out one in the fourth.
He needed some help from his defense to get out of the fifth.
He retired the next three batters to end the sixth.
He hit Salvador Perez with a pitch with one out in the seventh before striking out DeJong.
Fermin walked, prompting a visit from pitching coach Josh Miller.
Pre-Game Insights: There is no pre-game insights in this article.
Post-Match Reflections: There is no post-match reflections in this article.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Astros have 17 no-hitters in franchise history.

In addition to Blanco’s effort, there have been two other no-hitters this season. San Francisco’s Blake Snell shut down the Cincinnati Reds on Aug. 2, and San Diego’s Dylan Cease pitched a no-hitter against Washington on July 25.
Others: The Astros led 1-0 after a home run by Ben Gamel in the third inning.
